t: To the choirmaster: according to The Sheminith. A Psalm of David.
Save,*pn O Lord,*s for the godly one is gone; for*ld the faithful have vanished from among the children of man.
Everyone*ln utters lies to his neighbor; with*ld flattering lips and a double heart they speak.
May*pn the Lord*s cut off all flattering lips, the*ld tongue that makes great boasts,
those*ln who say, “With our tongue we will prevail, our*ld lips are with us; who is master over us?”
“Because*pn the poor are plundered, because the needy groan, I*ld will now arise,” says the Lord;*s “I*ld will place him in the safety for which he longs.”
The*ln words of the Lord*s are pure words, like*ld silver refined in a furnace on the ground, purified*ld seven times.
You,*pn O Lord,*s will keep them; you*ld will guard us from this generation forever.
On*ln every side the wicked prowl, as*ld vileness is exalted among the children of man.
